etymology.description: 明(明) (míng, "bright"; "clear"), 信(信) (xìn, "letter"; "trust"), 片(片) (piàn, "slice"; "piece")
etymology.interpretation: A 明(明) (míng, "clear") 信(信) (xìn, "letter") that is a 片(片) (piàn, "piece") is a 'postcard', which is a clear message sent on a single piece of card.

examples.chinese: 我收到一张明信片(我收到一張明信片)。
旅行中我寄了明信片(旅行中我寄了明信片)，向朋友问候(向朋友問候)。
examples.pinyin: Lǚxíng zhōng wǒ jìle míngxìnpiàn, xiàng péngyǒu wènhòu.
examples.english: During my trip, I mailed a postcard to greet my friend.

examples.chinese: 旅行结束时我在包里发现了明信片(旅行結束時我在包裡發現了明信片)，满载回忆(滿載回憶)。
examples.pinyin: Lǚxíng jiéshù shí wǒ zài bāo lǐ fāxiànle míngxìnpiàn, mǎnzài huíyì.
examples.english: At the end of the trip, I found a postcard in my bag, filled with memories.
